com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware

Interface DcMotorSimple

  • All Superinterfaces:
    HardwareDevice
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    CRServo, DcMotor
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CRServoImpl, DcMotorImpl, DcMotorImplEx

    public interface DcMotorSimple
extends HardwareDevice
    Represents a generic motorâ€”you can set its power and whether or not it is reversed. Currently, DcMotor and CRServo are the only such devices.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  DcMotorSimple.Direction
      DcMotors can be configured to internally reverse the values to which, e.g., their motor power is set.

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.HardwareDevice

        HardwareDevice.Manufacturer

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      DcMotorSimple.Direction getDirection()
      Gets the current direction that the motor is running in
      double getPower()
      Returns the power that the motor is moving at, where -1.0 means full power backwards, 0.0 means stopped or coasting, and 1.0 means full power forward.
      void setDirection(DcMotorSimple.Direction direction)
      Sets the current direction that the motor is running in
      void setPower(double power)
      Sets the motor's power, where -1.0 means full power backwards, 0.0 means stopped, and 1.0 means full power forward.

      • Methods inherited from interface com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.HardwareDevice

        close, getConnectionInfo, getDeviceName, getManufacturer, getVersion, resetDeviceConfigurationForOpMode

    • Method Detail

      • setDirection

        void setDirection(DcMotorSimple.Direction direction)
        Sets the current direction that the motor is running in
        See Also:
        DcMotorSimple.Direction, getDirection()

      • getDirection

        DcMotorSimple.Direction getDirection()
        Gets the current direction that the motor is running in
        Returns:
        the direction that the motor will move when set to a positive power
        See Also:
        DcMotorSimple.Direction, setDirection(Direction)

      • setPower

        void setPower(double power)
        Sets the motor's power, where -1.0 means full power backwards, 0.0 means stopped, and 1.0 means full power forward. In RUN_TO_POSITION mode, sets the maximum power to send to the motor.
        Parameters:
        power - the desired power (between -1 and 1)
        See Also:
        getPower()

      • getPower

        double getPower()
        Returns the power that the motor is moving at, where -1.0 means full power backwards, 0.0 means stopped or coasting, and 1.0 means full power forward.
        Returns:
        the motor's power value (between -1 and 1)
        See Also:
        setPower(double)
